items.name: Campo de Carabobo
items.address: Valencia Highway - Campo de Carabobo, Libertador Municipality.
items.description: A historic monument where the Battle of Carabobo was fought in 1821, a key event in Venezuela's independence. It features a triumphal arch, statues, and a museum.

items.name: Municipal Theater of Valencia
items.address: Calle Colombia, between Av. Urdaneta and Av. Soublette, Valencia.
items.description: A beautiful 19th-century theater with classic architecture. It hosts concerts, operas, and major cultural events in the city.

items.name: Negra Hipolita Park
items.description: One of the largest and most popular parks in Valencia. It offers walking trails, picnic areas, sports zones, and recreational events.

items.name: Isla Larga
items.address: Puerto Cabello Archipelago, accessible from the Quizandal dock.
items.description: One of the most beautiful beaches in Carabobo. Ideal for snorkeling, diving, and enjoying crystal-clear waters.

items.name: Malecón
items.description: A scenic seaside promenade with views of the Caribbean Sea. Perfect for enjoying the sea breeze, restaurants, cafes, and spectacular sunsets.

items.name: Dunas
items.address: San Diego, Carabobo (near the Metropolitan Park).
items.description: An impressive landscape of sand dunes, ideal for hiking and sandboarding. A unique spot for photography and nature connection.

items.name: Patanemo Bay
items.address: Puerto Cabello Municipality, accessible via the Patanemo road.
items.description: A paradisiacal beach surrounded by mountains and vegetation. Its crystal-clear waters and tranquil atmosphere make it ideal for relaxation.

items.name: El Casupo Hill
items.address: West of Valencia, entrance via Av. Andrés Eloy Blanco.
items.description: A popular spot for hiking and exercise. It offers multiple trails leading to viewpoints with panoramic views of the city.
